info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 8:53PM EDT until June 30 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson, Guilford and Randolph.
* WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... High Point, Asheboro, Lexington, Randleman, Thomasville, Archdale, Trinity, Pleasant Garden, Denton, Gordontown, Randleman Regional Reservior Marina, High Rock Lake Marina & Campground, High Rock Boat Dock Marina, Nc Wildlife Access Boat Launch, High Rock, Climax and High Rock Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT

area.areaDesc: Davidson, NC; Guilford, NC; Randolph, NC
